title: Best Made Co. Wonderful script
content:
I'd guess this is all hand-drawn but I'm thinking it may be based off of an existing typeface. Can anyone spot what typeface 'Wonderful' is based off of?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [WONDERFUL-T-600B\_1024x1024.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425043539/http:/typophile.com/files/WONDERFUL-T-600B_1024x1024.jpg) | 118.59 KB |
author: tylor.reimer

comments.content: Was almost certain I've already tried to identify it but can't find anything. Anyway, confirming hand-drawn hunch. Looks like a [Spoleto/Aktuelle/Athletic Script/Opti Sport Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425043539/http:/typophile.com/node/70274) x [Beaurencourt](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425043539/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontyou/beaurencourt-fy) job. Some alternatives: **Vellum/Swoon** (interesting but don't want to give any pointer to it as it's copyrighted by Summitsoft Corporation and I don't trust this source although I can't find any other "trusty" source for it), [Dausby](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425043539/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/corien/dausby), [Enrico Handwritting](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425043539/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/softmaker/enrico-handwriting), many [IHOF P22](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425043539/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/IHOF)

Thanks Ryuk. Beaurencourt seems quite nice. I also found a bunch of the Aring Typeface's had a similar letterforms. [Castro Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425043539/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/castro-script/), [Society Editor](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425043539/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/society-editor/) and [Dollie Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425043539/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/dollie-script/). It's quite possible the original script is just the designers own handwriting.
